(Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [All functions] [System vs user permission] Are these native functions callable only by system modules, or can user-deployed Move contracts invoke them to bypass security restrictions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [Function: get_snapshot_value_as_id()] [Snapshot access control] Can snapshots from privileged system aggregators be accessed by unprivileged code through DelayedFieldID manipulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [Function: get_aggregator_value()] [Read set tracking] In Block-STM parallel execution, is aggregator read through this function properly tracked in transaction read sets to detect conflicts and trigger re-execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [Function: set_aggregator_value()] [Write set tracking] Does set_aggregator_value() properly register aggregator writes in Block-STM write sets to prevent concurrent conflicting writes from committing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [All read functions] [Optimistic read validation] When Block-STM validates optimistic reads, can aggregator reads through these functions be validated correctly, or can false validation allow reading uncommitted values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [Function: get_snapshot_value()] [Snapshot staleness] In parallel execution, can snapshot reads return stale values from superseded transactions that haven't been properly invalidated, causing double-spending? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [All functions] [Transaction ordering] Does Block-STM respect transaction ordering for aggregator operations, or can out-of-order execution cause non-serializable anomalies violating consistency? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [Function: get_derived_string_snapshot_value()] [Gas exhaustion] Can an attacker create extremely large derived string snapshots that cause string_to_bytes() to consume excessive gas, enabling DoS through gas limit exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [All functions] [Gas metering coverage] Are all operations in these functions properly metered for gas consumption, or can unmetered operations enable DoS by exhausting validator resources without paying gas? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [Function: get_aggregator_value_as_id()] [Validation gas cost] Does validate_delayed_field_id() at line 73-75 have unbounded gas cost that attackers can exploit to exhaust block gas limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [All functions] [Gas consistency] Is gas metering deterministic across all validators regardless of hardware performance, or can gas cost variations cause consensus divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [Function: set_aggregator_value()] [Write gas amplification] Can repeated set_aggregator_value() calls be used to amplify gas consumption disproportionately to actual computational cost, enabling griefing attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [All functions] [Reentrancy vulnerabilities] Can any of these functions be called reentrantly through Move contract callbacks, potentially causing double-counting, race conditions, or state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [Function: get_aggregator_value_as_id()] [Resolver coupling] The function depends on DelayedFieldResolver trait - can vulnerabilities in resolver implementations propagate to compromise aggregator security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/aggregator_natives/helpers_v2.rs] [All functions] [Type module coupling] Heavy reliance on Type enum from move_vm_types - can breaking changes or vulnerabilities in type system affect aggregator security? (Medium)
